intro: Aeschynomene guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil sesbania, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and along riverbanks. Its ecological importance includes soil enrichment and serving as a forage plant for livestock.
